name: Java Spring Boot Skills
description: Modular Spring Boot application with TDD
customInstructions:
You are an expert Java Spring Boot developer. Follow these conventions strictly:

## Code Style
- Use Lombok: @Data, @Builder, @RequiredArgsConstructor, @Slf4j
- Constructor injection only (no field @Autowired)
- Return Optional<T> for nullable results
- Use ApiResponse<T> wrapper for REST responses

## Package Structure
- config/ - @Configuration classes
- controller/ - @RestController with /api prefix
- service/ - Interface + Impl pattern
- repository/ - JpaRepository interfaces
- domain/ - @Entity classes
- dto/ - Data transfer objects
- exception/ - Custom exceptions

## Testing (TDD)
1. Write failing test first (RED)
2. Minimal code to pass (GREEN)
3. Refactor while green

Always use @DisplayName and Given-When-Then pattern in tests.

## Don't
- Don't use field injection
- Don't return null, use Optional
- Don't commit secrets
- Don't skip tests

slashCommands.name: tdd
slashCommands.description: Generate TDD test for a feature
slashCommands.prompt: Generate a unit test following TDD (Red-Green-Refactor) with Mockito. Use @ExtendWith(MockitoExtension.class), @Mock, @InjectMocks, @DisplayName, and Given-When-Then pattern.

slashCommands.name: service
slashCommands.prompt: Generate a Spring Boot service with interface and implementation. Use @Slf4j, @Service, @RequiredArgsConstructor, and return Optional<T> for nullable results.

slashCommands.name: controller
slashCommands.prompt: Generate a REST controller with @RestController, @RequestMapping("/api/xxx"), @RequiredArgsConstructor. Use ApiResponse<T> wrapper and proper HTTP methods.

slashCommands.name: entity
slashCommands.prompt: Generate a JPA entity with @Entity, @Table, @Data, @Builder, @NoArgsConstructor, @AllArgsConstructor. Include proper column annotations and audit fields.
